entity.description: Join us at the Exponential Climate Action Summit IV, broadcast live from the diplomatic zone at #COP26 in Glasgow. How can innovation and digitalization provide scalable solutions to the #climatecrisis? With top speakers from Ericsson, Ragn-Sells, BT, Spotify and many more.

data.text: (1 of 2) Our Chairman Patrick Healy joined industry leaders at #COP26 session this week to share our ambition on using sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) for 10% of our total fuel consumption by 2030 and how we can accelerate SAF development in Asia.

urls.title: Home | Fly Pink Hong Kong
urls.description: 25 Sept, 9:00 am HKT – 05 Nov, 9:00 am HKT This year we have some exciting new products for the Fly Pink Hong Kong collection. Visit our Charity Sales shop before it runs out! Fly Pink is an initiative founded by QantasLink pilots in 2015. A small group of female pilots of Cathay Pacific Airways then continued the initiative from 2016 onwards. Currently it is run by a core volunteer team of 4 flight crew members. The Hong Kong Breast Cancer Foundation (HKBCF) was set up on 8 March 2005, as a non-profit

data.text: Together, let’s show support for breast health and make sure no one flies alone. By sharing photos using #flypinkhongkong, we can all help raise awareness about the importance of breast health. https://t.co/UuF6WvMpUz

urls.title: Our Economy fares
urls.description: There are currently no important alerts. Click "View all "to read our travel advisories. More choices. More flexibility. More value. We’ve designed our Economy fares to give you total choice and flexibility when booking flights. Our Light, Essential and Flex fares are tailored, so you never pay fo r what you don’t need. Each fare offers you increasingly more control and greater benefits, from enhanced baggage allowances to flexible rebooking and upgrade options. Jetting off for a weekend getaway or happy

data.text: No two travellers are the same—let alone three! That’s why we’ve introduced our new Economy fares to suit everyone. Whether you like travelling light, heading off on a long holiday, or need flexibility for your next business trip, you can now enjoy more choices and  benefits. https://t.co/FTTIt9EA8U

data.text:
Our new #A321neo made its inaugural flight yesterday 🛫from Hong Kong to Shanghai! The very definition of short and sweet, it elevates the short-haul experience with more comfort and space, better entertainment and greater ⛽ fuel efficiency.

#cathaypacific #MoveBeyond https://t.co/BQZNC0RhFI

Watch the video and discover how we make it happen.

Learn more: https://t.co/d7JQPlVNxz 

#cathaypacific #MoveBeyond https://t.co/JuAPtyCc9B
The thrill of travel heightens the moment you set foot on a plane. Our new Airbus #A321neo aircraft redefines air travel, providing passengers with the world's most enjoyable short-haul experience.

But as engines are designed to operate at this optimal altitude, commercial planes seldom fly higher because that would require more powerful engines!

📸 IG @ insideflight

#cathaypacific #MoveBeyond https://t.co/zslaEvGmBl

The ideal altitude for commercial planes usually lies between 30,000 and 42,000 feet ✈️. Thinner air and lighter traffic high up in the sky allow for fuel efficiency ⛽, smoother flights, and less turbulence.

data.text: Spirit dragons 🐉 live alongside people in Hong Kong, according to traditional beliefs. This explains the big holes found in the city’s massive buildings, an architectural feature called dragon gates.

data.text:
Let Yee Chow, our Climate Change and Biofuel Manager, tell you more (https://t.co/9VdHI5O0vG). 
 
#cathaypacific #MoveBeyond

“What is Sustainable Aviation Fuel?”
“What are we doing to reduce carbon emissions?”
 
We’ve pledged to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and some of you have questions #YouAskedUs about climate change.

Can you name some winglet shapes?

📸 IG @beebrownlow

#cathaypacific #MoveBeyond https://t.co/WUuUFOT3bd

data.text: Aircraft winglets come in all kinds of shapes. But they share a common purpose. Inspired by the upward curl of feathers on an eagle’s wings 🦅, winglets reduce induced drag in flight and can deliver 3–5% reductions in fuel burn 🔥!

We adjusted our air cargo operations to ship these essential supplies as part of our prioritisation of humanitarian relief efforts.

#cathaypacific #MoveBeyond https://t.co/lsyg498HWE
Furthering our contribution to pandemic relief efforts, we airlifted a gift of 300,000 COVID-19 testing kits from the State of Oregon to India at no cost.

data.text: While Couchsurfing and attending language classes are a great way to meet locals, an old-school approach we enjoy is to take public transport instead of cabbing around tourist attractions.

Did you know that aircraft wheels are filled with nitrogen? This is to minimise expansion and contraction from extreme changes in ambient temperature and pressure when flying. Also, it is non-flammable!
